column1: We created a tetracycline - responsive chimeric mouse / human APP695Swedish / Indiana ( swe / ind) vector by replacing the promoter region of the moPrP. XhoI vector ( also known as pPrPpE1 / E2, 3sal [ 15]) with the tetracycline - responsive promoter of pTetSplice ( Life Technologies, Rockville, Maryland, United States), and then ligating mouse APP with a humanized A beta domain ( mo / huAPP695) cDNA into the new vector.
